meanings.definition: A beadlike granule of chromatin that is believed to be a coiled-up chromosome segment.
meanings.sent1: Under the microscope, the chromomeres looked like tiny beads on a string.
meanings.sent2: During cell division, the chromomeres play a crucial role in chromosome organization.
meanings.sent3: The chromomeres at the party were the colorful beads on the chromosome necklace.
meanings.sent4: Her DNA was a storybook, with each chromomere a chapter waiting to unfold.
meanings.sent5: In the biology class, the teacher made the concept of chromomeres as clear as a bright bead in a dark room.
